host.description: This is the Emarsys API server

info.description:
Create and maintain administrator accounts within your organization.
Users with administratior privileges can use these endpoints to learn about and modify the administrator account settings that are applied for the organization.
info.title: SAP Emarsys Core - Accounts

externalDocs.description: For more information, please visit our official SAP Emarsys developer portal.

x-sap-shortText: Administrators of accounts can use these endpoints to create and maintain accounts

post.description:
Creates a new administrator account.

**Important:** Access to administrative endpoints is restricted. If you need access, contact Emarsys support.

schema.description: See the example or [Response Codes](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/core-api-reference/cnyqzhdnbl7r2-http-200-errors) for details.

username.description: The user name of the administrator.

first_name.description: The first name of the administrator.

last_name.description: The last name of the administrator.

interface_language.description: The ISO code of the current language used in the Emarsys application.

default_upages_lang.description: The default language of the www.emarsys.net/u/… links of the launched email campaigns.

access_level.description: The identifier of the administrator role. See [List Access Levels](/reference/openapi.json/paths/~1v3~1administrator~1getaccesslevels/get) for details.

position.description: The role or position of the administrator.

tz.description: The time zone where the administrator is located.

mobile_phone.description: The phone number of the administrator.

pwd_update_interval.description: The password expiration date in days.

username.description:
The user name of the administrator.

**Tip**: Use actual names for easier maintenance.

password.description:
The password of the administrator.

**Requirements**:
  - 10 or more characters
  - Must contain uppercase and lowercase letters as well as numbers

pwd_update_interval.description: The password expiration date in days.

email.description: The email address of the administrator.

access_level.description: he identifier of the administrator role. See [List access levels](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/core-api-reference/2qar3vo7bcbwv-list-access-levels) for details.

interface_language.description: The ISO code of the current language used in the Emarsys application. See [Get user interface languages](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/core-api-reference/uu39535atcf8e-get-user-interface-languages) for details.

default_upages_lang.description: The default language of the [www.emarsys.net/u/…](http://www.emarsys.net/u/..) links of the launched email campaigns.

first_name.description: The first name of the administrator.

last_name.description: The last name of the administrator.

mobile_phone.description: The phone number of the administrator.

position.description: The role or position of the administrator.

tz.description: The time zone where the administrator is located.

last_verification_action_date.description:
For internal use only.

**Note**: Dates must be defined in CET.

last_invitation_action_date.description:
For internal use only.

**Note**: Dates must be defined in CET.

actual_login.description:
The date of the last login.

**Note**: Dates must be defined in CET.

disabled.description: The status of the account. 0: Locked 1: Unlocked

superadmin.description:
The access level of the administrator. 0: Standard 1: Superadmin

**Note**: Superadmins can create, modify, and configure administrators for the account.

start_page.description: The page to redirect the administrator after login.

get.description:
Returns a list of administrator users of the customer's account.

**Important:** Access to administrative endpoints is restricted. If you need access, contact Emarsys support.

schema.description: See the example or [Response Codes](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/core-api-reference/cnyqzhdnbl7r2-http-200-errors) for details.

get.description:
Returns the current settings of the specified customer account, such as timezone or name.

**Important:** Access to administrative endpoints is restricted. If you need access, contact Emarsys support.

schema.description: See the example or [Response Codes](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/core-api-reference/cnyqzhdnbl7r2-http-200-errors) for details.

environment.description: The URI of the environment the customer account belongs to.

timezone.description:
The timezone of the customer account.

See [supported timezones](docs/appendix/timezones.md).

name.description: The name of the customer account.

password_history_queue_size.description: The number of the previous passwords that are no longer allowed to be used.

get.description:
Returns the details of an admininstrator user of the customer's account.

**Important:** Access to administrative endpoints is restricted. If you need access, contact Emarsys support.

Modifies the properties of an administrator account.

**Important:** Access to administrative endpoints is restricted. If you need access, contact Emarsys support.

get.description:
Returns the list of available access levels for the customer's account.

**Important:** Access to administrative endpoints is restricted. If you need access, contact Emarsys support.

post.summary: Create a Session for an Administrator Account
post.description:
Creates a session for administrators for logging in users from outside the Emarsys application, such as implementing Single Sign-On (SSO).

**Note:** This feature is in the pilot phase and currently available for a limited number of clients only. If you are interested in participating, contact Emarsys support.

**Important:** This feature is in the pilot phase and currently available for a limited number of clients only. If you are interested in participating, contact Emarsys support.

parameters.name: administratorId
parameters.description:
The identifier of the administrator.

**Note:** Get available administrators at the [List Administrator Accounts](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/core-api-reference/qzdmscigu4ezh-list-administrator-accounts) endpoint.

schema.description: See the example or [Response Codes](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/core-api-reference/cnyqzhdnbl7r2-http-200-errors) for details.

target.description:
Controls the page that the administrator first sees in the Emarsys application.
Define the following parameters in the `target_params` property.
  | Value | Possible Parameters |
  | --- | --- |
  | email_campaigns/list | - |
  | email_campaigns/edit | `campaign_id` |
  | email_analysis/list | - |
  | email_analysis/details | `campaign_id`, `launch_id` |
  | contact_lists/details | `contact_list_id` |
  | administrators/profile | `admin_id` |

contact_list_id.description: The identifier of the contact list.

campaign_id.description: The identifier of the email campaign

launch_id.description: The identifier of the email campaign launch.

get.description:
Returns the list of available user interface languages of the Emarsys application.

**Important:** Access to administrative endpoints is restricted. If you need access, contact Emarsys support.

schema.description: See the example or [Response Codes](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/core-api-reference/cnyqzhdnbl7r2-http-200-errors) for details.

data.description: The list of supported two-letter language codes.

get.description: Returns the list of available languages of the account.

schema.description: See the example or [Response Codes](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/core-api-reference/cnyqzhdnbl7r2-http-200-errors) for details.

data.description: The list of supported two-letter language codes.

get.description:
Lists the start pages where administrators are redirected to on login.

**Important:** Access to administrative endpoints is restricted. If you need access, contact Emarsys support.

schema.description: See the example or [Response Codes](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/core-api-reference/cnyqzhdnbl7r2-http-200-errors) for details.

oauth2ClientCredentials.description: To use this API, you must first obtain an OAuth 2.0 client credentials token. After that you can use the token to call the API. For more information, see [Authentication](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/emarsys-core-api-guides/branches/OAuth-2.0/b3c3a1eba8515-authentication-in-v3-api).

default-response-example.title: Default response

replyCode.description: The Emarsys response code. Successful requests return 0; otherwise, see [errors](https://dev.emarsys.com/docs/core-api-reference/jir98la21pufy-http-400-errors).

replyText.description: Additional informationon the status of the request.

data.description: Contains the requested data, if applicable.

default-response-example.description: This is the generic SAP Emarsys response.
